## 1. Definitions

For the purposes of these Terms, the following definitions apply:

**"Buyer"** or **"Customer"** means any User who purchases products, books services, acquires event tickets, or accesses on-demand content through the Platform.

**"Content"** means any text, images, audio, video, data, or other materials uploaded, posted, transmitted, or otherwise made available through the Platform.

**"Merchant Subscription"** means the recurring subscription plan that Vendors and Practitioners purchase to operate a storefront or practice on the Platform.

**"On-Demand Content"** means pre-recorded or pre-produced digital content available for purchase or access through the Platform, including but not limited to videos, podcasts, guided meditations, and courses.

**"Platform Fee"** means the service fee charged by SpiriVerse on transactions conducted through the Platform.

**"Practitioner"** means a User who offers synchronous services (such as tarot readings, astrology consultations, reiki sessions, coaching, or energy healing) or asynchronous deliverables (such as written readings or oracle messages) through the Platform.

**"Vendor"** means a User who sells physical products through the Platform, including but not limited to crystals, tarot decks, candles, jewelry, and spiritual tools.

**"User"** means any individual or entity that accesses or uses the Platform in any capacity, including Buyers, Vendors, and Practitioners.

- **(b) Synchronous Services:** Practitioners may offer live, real-time services such as tarot readings, astrology consultations, reiki sessions, spiritual coaching, energy healing, and similar services, delivered via the Platform's communication tools or approved third-party services.
- **(c) Asynchronous Deliverables:** Practitioners may offer pre-prepared or custom deliverables such as written readings, oracle messages, birth chart analyses, and similar items delivered digitally.

  - **Flexible:** Full refund if cancelled at least 24 hours before the scheduled time.

- **(b)** Buyers may request a refund if the deliverable is materially different from its description, not delivered within the stated timeframe, or otherwise fails to meet the standards described in the listing.

# SpiriVerse Privacy Policy

## 1. Introduction

This Privacy Policy explains how [COMPANY_ENTITY] ("SpiriVerse," "we," "us," or "our") collects, uses, discloses, retains, and protects personal information when you access or use the SpiriVerse platform ("Platform"), including our website, mobile applications, APIs, and related services.

SpiriVerse is a spiritual marketplace platform that connects users with vendors, practitioners, and spiritual services across Australia, the United Kingdom, and the United States. We are committed to protecting your privacy and handling your personal information in compliance with applicable data protection laws, including:

- **United Kingdom**: UK General Data Protection Regulation (UK GDPR) and the Data Protection Act 2018
- **Australia**: Privacy Act 1988 (Cth) and the Australian Privacy Principles (APPs)
- **United States**: California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) as amended by the California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA), and applicable state-level privacy laws including the Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act (VCDPA), Colorado Privacy Act (CPA), Connecticut Data Privacy Act (CTDPA), and other emerging state regulations

By accessing or using the Platform, you acknowledge that you have read and understood this Privacy Policy. If you do not agree with our practices, please do not use the Platform.

---

## 2. Data Controller and Contact Information

**Data Controller:** [COMPANY_ENTITY]

**General Inquiries:**
Email: contact@spiriverse.com

**Privacy Inquiries:**
Email: privacy@spiriverse.com

**Data Protection Officer (DPO):**
Email: [DPO_EMAIL]

Our Data Protection Officer oversees compliance with UK GDPR requirements and is available to address questions or concerns regarding the processing of your personal data. Individuals in any jurisdiction may contact the DPO for privacy-related matters.

---

## 3. Definitions

For the purposes of this Privacy Policy:

- **"Personal Information"** (also "Personal Data") means any information that identifies, relates to, describes, is reasonably capable of being associated with, or could reasonably be linked, directly or indirectly, with a particular individual or household.
- **"Sensitive Information"** means personal information that reveals racial or ethnic origin, religious or philosophical beliefs, or other categories designated as sensitive under applicable law.
- **"Processing"** means any operation performed on personal data, including collection, recording, organisation, structuring, storage, adaptation, retrieval, consultation, use, disclosure, dissemination, restriction, erasure, or destruction.
- **"User"** means any individual who creates an account on the Platform to browse, purchase, or engage with services and products.
- **"Vendor"** (also "Merchant") means any business entity or individual that lists products or services for sale on the Platform.
- **"Practitioner"** means any individual who offers spiritual services, readings, or consultations through the Platform.

---

## 4. Personal Information We Collect

### 4.1 User Profile Data

When you create and maintain a user account, we collect:

| Data Category | Specific Data Elements | Purpose |
|---|---|---|
| Identity Data | Full name, email address, phone number | Account creation, communication, identity verification |
| Contact Data | Billing address, shipping address(es) | Order fulfilment, tax calculation |
| Preference Data | Religion preference, spiritual interests (e.g., Mediumship, Paranormal, Crystals, Witchcraft, Energy, Herbalism, Faith) | Personalised recommendations, content curation |
| Payment Data | Payment cards (processed and stored by Stripe; we receive only card brand, last four digits, and expiration status) | Transaction processing |
| Security Data | Security questions and answers | Account recovery, identity verification |

**Note on Sensitive Information:** Religion preference and spiritual interests constitute sensitive personal information under UK GDPR (Article 9 - special category data) and the Australian Privacy Principles. We process this data only with your explicit consent, which you provide when you voluntarily supply these preferences during account setup or profile configuration. You may withdraw consent and remove these preferences at any time through your account settings.

### 4.2 Vendor and Merchant Data

When you register as a vendor or merchant, we collect:

| Data Category | Specific Data Elements | Purpose |
|---|---|---|
| Business Identity | Business name, URL slug, country of operation | Platform listing, public profile |
| Business Contact | Business address, contact information | Communication, legal compliance, tax obligations |
| Financial Data | Stripe Connect account information, subscription and billing details, fee breakdowns | Payment processing, commission management, subscription management |
| Branding Assets | Logo, banner image, branding colours, business descriptions | Public storefront presentation |
| Team Data | Team member profiles (names, roles, photos) | Storefront display, internal management |
| Location Data | Business location(s), service areas | Location-based search, service availability |
| Social Media | Social media account links | Public profile enrichment |
| Technical Data | Storage usage metrics | Platform resource management, billing |

### 4.3 Practitioner Data

When you register as a practitioner, we collect:

| Data Category | Specific Data Elements | Purpose |
|---|---|---|
| Professional Profile | Modalities offered, specialisations, years of experience | Service matching, public profile |
| Credentials | Training credentials, certifications | Trust and verification, quality assurance |
| Service Details | Reading style, availability, timezone, calendar data | Booking management, scheduling |
| Biographical Data | Bio, spiritual journey narrative | Public profile display |
| Verification Data | Verification status, badges earned | Trust indicators, platform integrity |

### 4.4 Order and Transaction Data

When you place or receive orders, we collect:

| Data Category | Specific Data Elements | Purpose |
|---|---|---|
| Order Details | Items purchased, quantities, pricing, order status, timestamps | Order fulfilment, history, customer support |
| Payment Records | Payment method (card brand, last four digits), Stripe transaction IDs | Payment processing, refund management, dispute resolution |
| Address Data | Shipping address, billing address | Delivery, tax calculation, fraud prevention |
| Inventory Data | Stock status, fulfilment tracking | Order management |
| Dispute Data | Refund requests, supporting evidence, resolution outcomes | Dispute resolution, fraud prevention |
| Fee Data | Platform fees, payment processing fees, marketplace fee breakdowns | Financial reporting, vendor settlements |

### 4.5 Analytics and Engagement Data

When you use the Platform, we automatically collect:

| Data Category | Specific Data Elements | Purpose |
|---|---|---|
| Session Data | Session IDs, page views, time on page, scroll depth | Platform improvement, performance optimisation |
| Device Data | Screen size, browser type and version, operating system | Technical compatibility, responsive design |
| Geographic Data | Country, approximate coordinates (IP-based) | Localisation, regional content, legal compliance |
| Referral Data | Referrer source URLs, UTM campaign parameters | Marketing attribution, traffic analysis |

### 4.6 Service Booking Data

When you book practitioner services, we collect:

| Data Category | Specific Data Elements | Purpose |
|---|---|---|
| Booking Preferences | Questionnaire responses, delivery preferences | Service customisation |
| Scheduling Data | Calendar availability, appointment times, reminders | Booking coordination |
| Delivery Data | Delivery files (e.g., recorded readings, reports) | Service fulfilment |
| Location Data | Practitioner address (disclosed post-booking confirmation only) | In-person service facilitation |
| Service Configuration | Selected add-ons, packages | Order accuracy, billing |

### 4.7 Community and Social Data

When you participate in community features, we collect:

| Data Category | Specific Data Elements | Purpose |
|---|---|---|
| Communications | Messages between users, comments on content | Service facilitation, dispute resolution, safety |
| Social Activity | Follows, social posts, wishlists | Community features, personalisation |

---

## 5. How We Collect Personal Information

We collect personal information through the following methods:

1. **Directly from you:** When you create an account, complete your profile, place orders, book services, submit forms, communicate with us, or participate in community features.
2. **Automatically:** When you use the Platform, through cookies, web beacons, pixels, and similar tracking technologies. See our [Cookie Policy] for details.
3. **From third parties:** Including Stripe (payment verification and fraud signals), identity verification services, and publicly available sources.
4. **From vendors and practitioners:** When they process your orders or service bookings through the Platform.

---

## 6. Lawful Bases for Processing (UK GDPR)

Under the UK GDPR, we must have a lawful basis for each processing activity. The following table sets out the lawful bases we rely on:

| Processing Activity | Lawful Basis | Explanation |
|---|---|---|
| Account creation and management | **Contract** (Art. 6(1)(b)) | Necessary to perform our contract with you (Terms of Service) |
| Order processing and fulfilment | **Contract** (Art. 6(1)(b)) | Necessary to fulfil purchase transactions |
| Payment processing via Stripe | **Contract** (Art. 6(1)(b)) | Necessary to process payments under our agreement |
| Service booking and delivery | **Contract** (Art. 6(1)(b)) | Necessary to facilitate booked services |
| Religion and spiritual interest preferences | **Explicit Consent** (Art. 9(2)(a)) | Special category data requiring explicit consent; you may withdraw consent at any time |
| Platform analytics and improvement | **Legitimate Interests** (Art. 6(1)(f)) | Our legitimate interest in improving Platform performance and user experience; balanced against your rights through data minimisation and pseudonymisation |
| Marketing communications | **Consent** (Art. 6(1)(a)) | Sent only with your opt-in consent; you may withdraw at any time |
| Fraud prevention and platform security | **Legitimate Interests** (Art. 6(1)(f)) | Our legitimate interest in protecting the Platform and its users from fraudulent or harmful activity |
| Legal and regulatory compliance | **Legal Obligation** (Art. 6(1)(c)) | Necessary to comply with tax, financial reporting, and other legal requirements |
| Community safety and content moderation | **Legitimate Interests** (Art. 6(1)(f)) | Our legitimate interest in maintaining a safe and respectful community |
| Dispute resolution and refund processing | **Contract** (Art. 6(1)(b)) and **Legitimate Interests** (Art. 6(1)(f)) | Necessary for contractual obligations and our legitimate interest in resolving disputes fairly |

Where we rely on legitimate interests, we have conducted balancing tests to ensure our interests do not override your fundamental rights and freedoms. You may request details of these assessments by contacting our DPO.

---

## 7. How We Use Personal Information

We use the personal information we collect for the following purposes:

### 7.1 Platform Operations
- Creating and managing your account
- Processing and fulfilling orders (products and services)
- Facilitating payments between users, vendors, and practitioners
- Managing subscriptions and billing for vendors
- Coordinating service bookings, scheduling, and reminders
- Delivering digital content and service files

### 7.2 Personalisation and Recommendations
- Providing personalised content based on your spiritual interests and preferences
- Recommending relevant vendors, practitioners, products, and services
- Customising your browsing experience based on location and preferences

### 7.3 Communication
- Sending transactional communications (order confirmations, booking updates, shipping notifications)
- Responding to inquiries and providing customer support
- Sending marketing communications (with your consent)
- Facilitating messaging between users, vendors, and practitioners

### 7.4 Platform Improvement and Analytics
- Analysing usage patterns to improve Platform features and performance
- Conducting A/B testing and feature evaluation
- Monitoring Platform health, uptime, and error resolution
- Understanding traffic sources and marketing effectiveness

### 7.5 Safety, Security, and Compliance
- Detecting and preventing fraud, abuse, and policy violations
- Verifying practitioner credentials and maintaining quality standards
- Complying with tax, financial, and regulatory obligations in AU, UK, and US
- Resolving disputes, processing refunds, and managing chargebacks
- Enforcing our Terms of Service and Platform policies

---

## 8. Data Sharing and Disclosure

We share personal information only as described below. We do not sell personal information (see Section 14 for California-specific disclosures).

### 8.1 Service Providers and Processors

| Third Party | Data Shared | Purpose | Location |
|---|---|---|---|
| **Stripe, Inc.** | Payment card details, transaction data, identity verification data, Stripe Connect account information | Payment processing, fraud detection, vendor payouts, subscription billing | United States (with global infrastructure) |
| **Microsoft Azure** | All Platform data (encrypted at rest and in transit) | Cloud hosting, data storage (Cosmos DB), file storage, compute services | Regions aligned with user geography (Australia, UK, US) |
| **Analytics processors** | Session data, device data, geographic data, engagement metrics | Platform analytics, performance monitoring | As disclosed in our Cookie Policy |

### 8.2 Vendors and Practitioners

When you place an order or book a service, we share relevant information with the vendor or practitioner to fulfil your transaction:

- **Order fulfilment:** Name, shipping address, order details
- **Service bookings:** Name, questionnaire responses, booking preferences, contact information necessary for service delivery
- **Post-confirmation disclosure:** Practitioner addresses are shared with users only after booking confirmation for in-person services

Vendors and practitioners on the Platform are independent data controllers for information they receive through the Platform. Their use of your data is subject to their own privacy practices.

### 8.3 Other Users

- **Public profiles:** Vendor business information, practitioner profiles, branding, descriptions, team information, and social media links
- **Community features:** Posts, comments, follows, and other social interactions you choose to share

### 8.4 Legal and Regulatory Disclosure

- To comply with regulatory requirements or government requests
- To protect the rights, property, or safety of SpiriVerse, our users, or the public

### 8.5 Business Transfers

---

## 9. International Data Transfers

SpiriVerse operates across Australia, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Your personal information may be transferred to and processed in countries other than the country in which you reside.

### 9.1 Transfers from the United Kingdom

For transfers of personal data outside the UK, we rely on:

- **Adequacy decisions:** Transfers to countries that the UK Secretary of State has determined provide an adequate level of data protection
- **Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs):** UK International Data Transfer Agreement (IDTA) or the UK Addendum to the EU SCCs, as appropriate

### 9.3 Transfers from the United States

# Cookie Policy

**Effective Date:** [EFFECTIVE_DATE]

This Cookie Policy explains how SpiriVerse ("we", "us", or "our") uses cookies and similar technologies when you visit or use our spiritual marketplace platform at spiriverse.com. SpiriVerse operates across Australia, the United Kingdom, and the United States.

We encourage you to read this policy in full so you understand what information we collect using cookies and how that information is used.

---

## 1. What Are Cookies?

Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device (computer, tablet, or mobile phone) when you visit a website. They allow the website to recognise your device and remember information about your visit, such as your preferences, login state, and browsing activity.

Cookies can be "first-party" (set by the website you are visiting) or "third-party" (set by a service used by the website, such as an analytics or payment provider). They can also be "session" cookies (deleted when you close your browser) or "persistent" cookies (remaining on your device for a set period or until you delete them).

---

## 2. How We Use Cookies

We use cookies for the following purposes:

- **Authentication and security** -- keeping you signed in and protecting your account.
- **Platform functionality** -- remembering your preferences and ensuring the platform works correctly.
- **Analytics and performance** -- understanding how visitors use SpiriVerse so we can improve the experience.
- **Payment processing** -- enabling secure transactions through our payment provider, Stripe.

---

## 3. Types of Cookies We Use

### 3.1 Essential Cookies

These cookies are strictly necessary for the platform to function. They enable core features such as authentication, session management, and security. You cannot opt out of essential cookies because the platform will not work without them.

| Cookie Name | Provider | Purpose | Duration |
|---|---|---|---|
| `session_id` | SpiriVerse | Authenticates your session after login and maintains your signed-in state across pages. | Session (expires when browser is closed) |
| `csrf_token` | SpiriVerse | Protects against cross-site request forgery attacks by validating form submissions. | Session |
| `__next_hmr_refresh` | Next.js | Used internally by the Next.js framework to manage page hydration and navigation state. | Session |
| `__Secure-next-auth.session-token` | Next.js / SpiriVerse | Stores the encrypted authentication session token for secure sign-in. | 30 days |
| `__Host-next-auth.csrf-token` | Next.js / SpiriVerse | CSRF protection token used by the authentication framework. | Session |
| `__Secure-next-auth.callback-url` | Next.js / SpiriVerse | Stores the callback URL for authentication redirects. | Session |

### 3.2 Analytics Cookies

These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with SpiriVerse. The data collected is aggregated and used to improve platform performance and user experience. Analytics cookies collect the following types of data:

- Session identifiers (anonymous)
- Pages viewed and navigation paths
- Time spent on each page
- Scroll depth on pages
- Device type, browser, and operating system
- Referrer source (how you arrived at SpiriVerse)
- UTM campaign parameters (e.g., `utm_source`, `utm_medium`, `utm_campaign`)

| Cookie Name | Provider | Purpose | Duration |
|---|---|---|---|
| `_sv_session` | SpiriVerse | Anonymous session identifier used to group page views and interactions into a single visit for analytics. | 30 minutes from last activity |
| `_sv_device` | SpiriVerse | Stores an anonymous device identifier to understand returning visitor patterns. | 1 year |
| `_sv_referrer` | SpiriVerse | Records the original referrer source and UTM parameters for the current session. | Session |
| `_sv_scroll` | SpiriVerse | Tracks maximum scroll depth on content pages to help us understand engagement. | Session |

### 3.3 Functional Cookies

These cookies enable enhanced functionality and personalisation, such as remembering your preferred market region or display settings.

| Cookie Name | Provider | Purpose | Duration |
|---|---|---|---|
| `sv_market` | SpiriVerse | Remembers your selected market region (AU, UK, or US) so you see relevant content, currency, and practitioners. | 1 year |
| `sv_preferences` | SpiriVerse | Stores user interface preferences such as sidebar state or view mode selections. | 1 year |
| `sv_cookie_consent` | SpiriVerse | Records your cookie consent choices so you are not asked again on every visit. | 1 year |

### 3.4 Third-Party Cookies

We use third-party services that may set their own cookies on your device. We do not control the cookies set by these services. Please refer to each provider's own cookie and privacy policies for details.

#### Stripe (Payment Processing)

Stripe is our payment processing provider. When you make a purchase, view a checkout page, or manage payment methods, Stripe may set cookies to enable secure payment processing and fraud prevention.

| Cookie Name | Provider | Purpose | Duration |
|---|---|---|---|
| `__stripe_mid` | Stripe | Unique identifier for fraud prevention and payment security. | 1 year |
| `__stripe_sid` | Stripe | Session identifier for payment processing. Used to maintain state during a transaction. | 30 minutes |
| `m` | Stripe | Used by Stripe for fraud detection and risk assessment. | 2 years |

For more information, see the [Stripe Cookie Policy](https://stripe.com/cookies-policy/legal).

---

## 4. Cookie Consent

When you first visit SpiriVerse, you will be presented with a cookie consent banner that allows you to accept or customise your cookie preferences. You can choose to:

- **Accept all cookies** -- enables all cookie categories described in this policy.
- **Accept essential cookies only** -- allows only the cookies strictly necessary for the platform to function. Analytics, functional, and third-party non-essential cookies will not be set.
- **Customise your preferences** -- select which categories of non-essential cookies you wish to allow.

You can change your cookie preferences at any time by visiting the cookie settings in the platform footer or your account settings.

**Important for UK users:** In accordance with the Privacy and Electronic Communications Regulations 2003 (PECR), we obtain your explicit consent before setting any non-essential cookies. Essential cookies that are strictly necessary for the service you have requested do not require consent under PECR. We store a record of your consent choice so we can demonstrate compliance.

---

## 5. Managing Cookies in Your Browser

In addition to our consent mechanism, you can control cookies through your browser settings. Below are instructions for the most common browsers:

### Google Chrome

1. Click the three-dot menu and select **Settings**.
2. Navigate to **Privacy and security** > **Cookies and other site data**.
3. Choose your preferred cookie setting or manage exceptions for specific sites.

### Mozilla Firefox

1. Click the hamburger menu and select **Settings**.
2. Navigate to **Privacy & Security**.
3. Under **Cookies and Site Data**, adjust your preferences or clear stored data.

### Safari

1. Open **Preferences** from the Safari menu.
2. Go to the **Privacy** tab.
3. Adjust cookie and tracking settings as needed.

### Microsoft Edge

1. Click the three-dot menu and select **Settings**.
2. Navigate to **Cookies and site permissions** > **Manage and delete cookies and site data**.
3. Adjust your preferences.

### Mobile Browsers

On iOS and Android devices, cookie settings are typically found in your browser's settings menu under **Privacy** or **Site Settings**. Consult your browser's help documentation for specific instructions.

---

## 6. Impact of Disabling Cookies

If you choose to disable or block certain cookies, please be aware of the following consequences:

| Cookie Category | Impact of Disabling |
|---|---|
| **Essential** | You will not be able to sign in, maintain a session, or use core platform features. The platform will not function correctly. |
| **Analytics** | We will not be able to collect usage data about your visit. This does not affect your ability to use the platform but limits our ability to improve it. |
| **Functional** | Your preferences (such as market region) will not be saved between visits. You may need to re-select your region each time. |
| **Third-party (Stripe)** | Payment processing may be affected. You may experience issues completing purchases or managing payment methods. Stripe's fraud detection may also be impaired, which could lead to transactions being declined. |

---

## 7. UK PECR Compliance

For users in the United Kingdom, our use of cookies complies with the Privacy and Electronic Communications Regulations 2003 (PECR) as amended, in addition to the UK General Data Protection Regulation (UK GDPR). Specifically:

- We provide clear and comprehensive information about what each cookie does before it is set.
- We obtain your consent before placing any non-essential cookies on your device.
- Essential cookies that are strictly necessary for the provision of the service you have requested are exempt from the consent requirement under Regulation 6(4) of PECR.
- We provide a straightforward way for you to withdraw your consent at any time.
- We keep records of consent for auditing purposes.

---

## 8. Data Retention

Cookie data is retained only for as long as necessary to fulfil its stated purpose. Session cookies are deleted when you close your browser. Persistent cookies remain on your device for the duration specified in the tables above, unless you delete them sooner through your browser settings or our consent mechanism.

Analytics data collected via cookies is aggregated and anonymised. We do not use analytics cookies to build personal profiles or identify individual users.

---

## 9. Updates to This Policy

We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices, technology, or legal requirements. When we make changes, we will update the "Effective Date" at the top of this policy. If we make material changes, we will notify you through a notice on the platform or by re-presenting the cookie consent banner.

We encourage you to review this policy periodically to stay informed about how we use cookies.

---

## 10. Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Cookie Policy or our use of cookies, please contact us at:

**Email:** contact@spiriverse.com

You may also write to us at:

SpiriVerse
Email: contact@spiriverse.com

---

---

## 1. Definitions

**"Connected Account"** means your Stripe account created and linked through the Platform for payment processing.

**"Customer"** means any individual who purchases products, books services, registers for events, or accesses content through the Platform.

**"Listing"** means any product, service, event, or content offering you publish on the Platform.

**"Market"** means the geographic jurisdiction in which you operate (Australia, United Kingdom, or United States).

**"Payout"** means the transfer of funds from your Connected Account to your designated bank account.

**"Platform Fee"** means the percentage-based and fixed-amount fees charged by SpiriVerse on each transaction, as determined by your Market.

**"Storefront"** means your customizable merchant page on the Platform.

**"Subscription"** means your recurring Platform access plan (monthly or yearly).

---

## 2. Merchant Eligibility and Onboarding

### 2.1 Eligibility

To become a Merchant on SpiriVerse, you must:

- (a) Be at least 18 years of age (or the age of majority in your jurisdiction);
- (b) Be legally able to enter into binding contracts;
- (c) Operate a legitimate business or practice in a supported Market (Australia, United Kingdom, or United States);
- (d) Provide accurate and complete registration information;
- (e) Comply with all applicable laws and regulations in your Market; and
- (f) Offer products, services, events, or content that fall within the categories permitted on the Platform.

### 2.2 Account Registration

During registration, you must provide:

- (a) Your legal business name or personal name (if operating as a sole trader/sole proprietor);
- (b) A valid email address;
- (c) Your business address and operating Market;
- (d) Any professional licenses, certifications, or credentials relevant to your offerings; and
- (e) Any other information reasonably requested during the onboarding process.

### 2.3 Accuracy of Information

You are responsible for keeping all account information current and accurate. You must promptly update your account if any information changes. Providing false or misleading information is grounds for immediate account suspension or termination.

### 2.4 One Account Per Entity

Each legal entity or individual may maintain only one Merchant account. Operating multiple accounts without prior written approval from SpiriVerse is prohibited.

---

## 3. Stripe Connected Account Requirements

### 3.1 Stripe Integration

SpiriVerse uses Stripe as its payment processing partner. As a condition of receiving payments through the Platform, you must:

- (a) Create and maintain a Stripe Connected Account linked to your SpiriVerse merchant account;
- (b) Complete all identity verification and onboarding steps required by Stripe;
- (c) Agree to and comply with Stripe's [Connected Account Agreement](https://stripe.com/connect-account/legal) and [Terms of Service](https://stripe.com/legal); and
- (d) Provide accurate banking information for payout purposes.

### 3.2 Stripe Compliance

You acknowledge that Stripe may independently suspend, restrict, or terminate your Connected Account in accordance with its own policies. SpiriVerse is not responsible for actions taken by Stripe, though we will make reasonable efforts to assist you in resolving issues.

### 3.3 Payment Card Requirement

You must save a valid payment card to your SpiriVerse account. This card is used for Subscription billing and any fees or adjustments owed to SpiriVerse. Payouts will be blocked until a valid payment card is on file (see Section 7).

---

## 4. Go-Live Requirements

### 4.1 Publishing Gating

Your Storefront will not be published or visible to Customers until all of the following requirements are met:

- (a) **Payment card saved** -- A valid payment card must be on file for Subscription and fee billing;
- (b) **Payment method configured** -- Your payout banking details must be fully configured; and
- (c) **Stripe onboarding complete** -- Your Stripe Connected Account must be fully verified and in good standing.

### 4.2 Automatic Publication

Once all three go-live requirements are satisfied, your Storefront may be automatically published. You are responsible for ensuring your Listings and Storefront content are ready before completing the final go-live requirement.

### 4.3 Suspension of Published Status

If any go-live requirement ceases to be met (for example, your payment card expires or your Stripe account is restricted), your Storefront may be suspended from public visibility until the requirement is restored.

---

## 5. Subscription and Billing

### 5.1 Subscription Plans

Access to the Platform as a Merchant requires an active Subscription. We offer:

- (a) **Monthly billing** -- Billed on a recurring monthly cycle; and
- (b) **Yearly billing** -- Billed on a recurring annual cycle, typically at a discounted rate compared to monthly billing.

Current Subscription pricing is displayed in your merchant dashboard and on our pricing page.

### 5.2 Deferred Billing Start

Your Subscription billing does not begin at account creation. Instead, billing commences when your **first payout is initiated** through the Platform. This means you can set up your Storefront, configure your Listings, and prepare your account without incurring Subscription charges until you start earning revenue.

### 5.3 Billing Cycle

Once billing begins:

- (a) Monthly Subscriptions renew on the same day each month (or the last day of the month if the original date does not exist in a given month);
- (b) Yearly Subscriptions renew on the anniversary of your billing start date; and
- (c) All charges are billed to the payment card on file.

### 5.4 Failed Payments

If a Subscription payment fails, we will:

- (a) Notify you by email;
- (b) Retry the charge according to our retry schedule; and
- (c) If payment remains unsuccessful after reasonable retry attempts, suspend your account until the outstanding balance is resolved.

### 5.5 Cancellation

You may cancel your Subscription at any time through your merchant dashboard. Upon cancellation:

- (a) Your Subscription remains active until the end of the current billing period;

### 5.6 Price Changes

We reserve the right to change Subscription pricing with at least 30 days' written notice. Price changes take effect at the start of your next billing cycle following the notice period.

## 6. Platform Fees

### 6.1 Fee Structure

SpiriVerse charges a Platform Fee on each Customer transaction processed through the Platform. Fees consist of two components:

- (a) **Percentage component** -- A percentage of the transaction amount; and
- (b) **Fixed component** -- A fixed amount per transaction, denominated in the smallest currency unit of your Market (e.g., cents for AUD/USD, pence for GBP).

### 6.2 Market-Based Fees

Fee rates vary by Market (Australia, United Kingdom, United States). Each Market has its own fee schedule reflecting local payment processing costs, currency considerations, and regulatory requirements. Your applicable fee schedule is determined by the Market you selected during onboarding.

### 6.3 Fee Transparency

Your current fee rates are always visible in your merchant dashboard. Before completing onboarding, the applicable fees for your Market will be clearly displayed for your review.

### 6.4 Fee Collection

Platform Fees are deducted automatically from each transaction before the net amount is credited to your Connected Account. You will receive a clear breakdown of gross amount, Platform Fee, and net amount for every transaction.

### 6.5 Additional Payment Processing Fees

In addition to SpiriVerse Platform Fees, Stripe charges its own payment processing fees. These fees are governed by your agreement with Stripe and are separate from SpiriVerse fees. Combined fee information is displayed in your transaction records.

### 6.6 Fee Changes

We may adjust fee rates with at least 30 days' written notice. Updated fees apply to transactions occurring after the effective date. If you do not agree to the revised fees, you may cancel your Subscription before the changes take effect.

---

## 7. Payouts

### 7.1 Payout Prerequisites

To receive Payouts, you must have:

- (a) A valid payment card saved to your account;
- (b) A fully verified Stripe Connected Account with valid banking details; and
- (c) An active, published Storefront.

If any of these prerequisites are not met, Payouts will be blocked until the issue is resolved.

### 7.2 Payout Schedule

Payouts are processed according to the schedule configured in your Stripe Connected Account, subject to Stripe's standard payout timing for your Market. Typical payout timing varies by Market and may be affected by weekends, public holidays, and banking processing times.

### 7.3 Payout Holds

SpiriVerse and/or Stripe may place temporary holds on Payouts in the following circumstances:

- (a) Suspected fraudulent activity;
- (b) Unresolved Customer disputes or chargebacks;
- (c) Account verification issues;
- (d) Violation of these Merchant Terms; or
- (e) As required by law or regulation.

### 7.4 Minimum Payout Amounts

Stripe may enforce minimum payout thresholds. If your balance does not meet the minimum, the balance will carry forward until the threshold is reached.

### 7.5 Currency

All transactions and Payouts are processed in the local currency of your Market (AUD for Australia, GBP for the United Kingdom, USD for the United States).

---

## 8. Product Listings

### 8.1 Listing Accuracy

All product Listings must be accurate, truthful, and not misleading. You must provide:

- (a) Clear, accurate product descriptions;
- (b) Genuine product images that accurately represent the item;
- (c) Correct pricing, including any applicable taxes or shipping costs;
- (d) Accurate inventory levels; and
- (e) Clear information about any variations (size, color, etc.).

### 8.2 Inventory Management

You are responsible for maintaining accurate inventory counts. The Platform supports both in-stock and backorder inventory models:

- (a) **In-stock items** must reflect actual available quantities;
- (b) **Backorder items** must clearly indicate expected fulfillment timeframes to Customers; and
- (c) You must promptly update inventory when items become unavailable.

### 8.3 Prohibited Products

You must not list products that:

- (a) Are illegal in your Market or the Customer's jurisdiction;
- (b) Infringe on any third party's intellectual property rights;
- (c) Are counterfeit, fraudulent, or misrepresented;
- (d) Make unsubstantiated medical, health, or therapeutic claims;
- (e) Are classified as controlled substances;
- (f) Contain hazardous materials without proper disclosure and compliance;
- (g) Violate any applicable consumer protection laws; or
- (h) Are otherwise prohibited under SpiriVerse's [Acceptable Use Policy].

### 8.4 Health and Wellness Claims

Given the nature of the SpiriVerse marketplace, Merchants offering wellness, spiritual, or holistic products must:

- (a) Clearly distinguish between spiritual/wellness practices and medical advice;
- (b) Not claim that products cure, treat, or prevent any medical condition unless supported by evidence accepted by the relevant regulatory authority in your Market;
- (c) Include appropriate disclaimers where required by law; and
- (d) Comply with all applicable advertising standards and consumer protection regulations.

### 8.5 Pricing

All prices must be displayed in the local currency of your Market. You are responsible for ensuring your prices comply with any applicable pricing regulations, including requirements for displaying tax-inclusive or tax-exclusive prices as mandated by your Market.

### 8.6 Refund Policy Configuration

You must configure a refund policy for each product Listing. Your refund policy must comply with the minimum consumer protection requirements of your Market (see Section 15). Failure to configure a refund policy may result in your Listing being unpublished.

---

## 9. Service Delivery

### 9.1 Service Listings

Merchants offering services (consultations, readings, sessions, treatments, etc.) must:

- (a) Provide clear descriptions of the service being offered;
- (b) Specify the duration, delivery method, and any prerequisites;
- (c) Set accurate availability through the Platform's calendar system;
- (d) Respond to booking requests in a timely manner; and
- (e) Fulfill booked services as described.

### 9.2 Delivery Methods

The Platform supports multiple service delivery methods (in-person, phone, video, etc.). You must:

- (a) Accurately indicate which delivery methods are available for each service;
- (b) Provide necessary connection details or location information before the appointment; and
- (c) Be available and ready at the scheduled time.

### 9.3 Questionnaires

Where you have configured intake questionnaires for your services:

- (a) Questionnaires must collect only information reasonably necessary for the service;
- (b) Customer responses must be handled in accordance with applicable privacy laws; and
- (c) You must not use questionnaire data for purposes beyond the stated service.

### 9.4 Cancellations and No-Shows

You must establish and clearly communicate your cancellation policy. If you need to cancel a booked service:

- (a) Notify the Customer as early as possible;
- (b) Offer a full refund or rescheduling option; and
- (c) Repeated cancellations by you may result in account review or suspension.

---

## 10. Event Hosting

### 10.1 Event Listings

Merchants hosting events must:

- (a) Provide accurate event details including date, time, location (physical or virtual), and description;
- (b) Set appropriate capacity limits;
- (c) Manage ticket sales and registration through the Platform;
- (d) Clearly communicate any requirements for attendees (equipment, preparation, etc.); and
- (e) Deliver the event as described.

### 10.2 Capacity Management and Waitlists

The Platform provides capacity management tools. You must:

- (a) Set honest capacity limits that you can accommodate;
- (b) Manage waitlists fairly and in the order Customers joined; and
- (c) Notify waitlisted Customers promptly when spots become available.

### 10.3 Event Cancellation

If you must cancel an event:

- (a) Notify all registered attendees as early as possible;
- (b) Process full refunds for all registered attendees;
- (c) Provide a clear explanation for the cancellation; and
- (d) Repeated event cancellations may result in account review or suspension.

### 10.4 Venue and Safety

For in-person events, you are solely responsible for:

- (a) Securing an appropriate venue;
- (b) Ensuring the venue meets all local health and safety requirements;
- (c) Obtaining any necessary permits or licenses; and
- (d) Maintaining adequate insurance coverage (see Section 24).

---

## 11. Content and Livestreaming

### 11.1 Content Hosting

The Platform supports hosting video content, podcasts, and on-demand media. You must:

- (a) Ensure all content complies with these Merchant Terms and our [Acceptable Use Policy];
- (b) Hold all necessary rights, licenses, and permissions for the content you upload;
- (c) Accurately describe and categorize your content; and
- (d) Not upload content that is illegal, harmful, or infringes on third-party rights.

### 11.2 Livestreaming

When using the Platform's livestreaming features, you must:

- (a) Comply with all applicable broadcasting regulations in your Market;
- (b) Moderate chat and interactions during livestreams;
- (c) Not stream content that violates these Merchant Terms or the [Acceptable Use Policy];
- (d) Have a reasonable plan for managing disruptive participants; and
- (e) Not use livestreaming to promote or sell prohibited products or services.

### 11.3 Chat Moderation

You are responsible for moderating interactive features (chat, comments, etc.) associated with your content and livestreams. This includes:

- (a) Removing or addressing harmful, abusive, or illegal content from participants;
- (b) Complying with applicable laws regarding user-generated content; and
- (c) Reporting serious concerns (threats of harm, illegal activity) to appropriate authorities and to SpiriVerse.

---

## 12. Practitioner Verification

### 12.1 Verification System

SpiriVerse operates a practitioner verification system that awards badges to Merchants who meet certain criteria. Verification may include (but is not limited to):

- (a) Identity verification;
- (b) Professional credential verification;
- (c) Business registration verification; and
- (d) Customer review thresholds.

### 12.2 Verification Obligations

If you participate in the verification program:

- (a) All information submitted for verification must be truthful and accurate;
- (b) You must notify SpiriVerse promptly if your credentials, licenses, or qualifications change or lapse;
- (c) Verification badges remain the property of SpiriVerse and may be revoked if requirements are no longer met; and
- (d) Misrepresenting your verification status is grounds for immediate account termination.

### 12.3 No Endorsement

Verification indicates that certain criteria have been checked. It does not constitute an endorsement, recommendation, or guarantee of the quality of your services by SpiriVerse.

---

## 13. Storefront and Branding

### 13.1 Customization

The Platform allows you to customize your Storefront with colors, fonts, panels, and banners. When customizing your Storefront:

- (a) All branding must be your own or used with proper authorization;
- (b) Branding must not infringe on SpiriVerse's or any third party's trademarks or intellectual property;
- (c) Content must comply with these Merchant Terms and the [Acceptable Use Policy]; and
- (d) SpiriVerse reserves the right to remove branding that violates these terms.

### 13.2 Merchant Responsibility

You are solely responsible for the content and appearance of your Storefront. SpiriVerse does not review or approve Storefront content prior to publication.

---

## 14. Team Members and Location Management

### 14.1 Team Members

If you add team member profiles to your account:

- (a) You are responsible for the actions of all team members operating under your account;
- (b) Team members must comply with these Merchant Terms;
- (c) You must have authorization from each individual to create their profile and display their information; and
- (d) You must promptly remove profiles of individuals who are no longer part of your team.

### 14.2 Location Management

If you manage physical locations through the Platform:

- (a) All location information must be accurate and current;
- (b) Operating hours must reflect actual availability; and
- (c) You must promptly update location information if it changes.

### 15.1 Merchant Refund Policies

You must configure a refund policy for your Listings. Your refund policy is displayed to Customers before purchase and forms part of the transaction agreement between you and the Customer.

### 15.2 Minimum Consumer Rights

Regardless of your configured refund policy, you must honor the minimum consumer protection rights mandated by law in each Market:

- (a) **Australia** -- Comply with the Australian Consumer Law, including consumer guarantees for products and services. Customers have rights to remedies (repair, replacement, or refund) when goods or services fail to meet consumer guarantees, regardless of your stated refund policy;
- (b) **United Kingdom** -- Comply with the Consumer Rights Act 2015 and the Consumer Contracts (Information, Cancellation and Additional Charges) Regulations 2013, including the 14-day cooling-off period for distance sales where applicable; and
- (c) **United States** -- Comply with applicable federal and state consumer protection laws, including the FTC's Mail, Internet, or Telephone Order Merchandise Rule and any applicable state-specific return and refund requirements.

### 15.3 Refund Processing

When a refund is warranted:

- (a) Process refunds promptly through the Platform's refund system;
- (b) Do not direct Customers to seek refunds outside the Platform;
- (c) Refunds are returned to the Customer's original payment method; and
- (d) Platform Fees on refunded transactions may be non-refundable (as specified in your fee schedule).

### 15.4 Responsibility

### 16.1 Standards

When communicating with Customers through the Platform, you must:

- (b) Be professional, respectful, and helpful;
- (c) Provide accurate information about your products, services, events, and content;
- (d) Not engage in harassment, intimidation, or abusive behavior; and

- (b) Solicit Customers found through the Platform to conduct future business off-Platform; or
- (c) Use Customer data obtained through the Platform in violation of applicable privacy laws.

SpiriVerse provides a case management system for handling Customer disputes. When a dispute is raised:

- (b) You must respond to dispute cases within the timeframe specified in the case notification;
- (c) You must provide honest, complete information and any requested evidence; and

11. [Auto-Refund Mechanism](#11-auto-refund-mechanism)
12. [Your Statutory Rights](#12-your-statutory-rights)
13. [Exceptions and Exclusions](#13-exceptions-and-exclusions)
14. [Contact Us](#14-contact-us)

## 1. General Refund Principles

SpiriVerse facilitates transactions between buyers and independent merchants. Each merchant may set their own refund terms within the framework established by this policy. The following principles apply to all transactions:

- **Merchant-specific policies are displayed at checkout.** Before completing a purchase, you will see the applicable refund or cancellation policy set by the merchant for that specific product, service, or event.
- **Statutory rights are always preserved.** Regardless of any merchant-specific policy, your rights under applicable consumer protection law are not affected.
- **Fair resolution is our goal.** SpiriVerse provides a dispute resolution process when buyers and merchants cannot reach agreement.
- **Refund eligibility depends on the type of purchase.** Physical products, services, events, and digital content each have different refund rules, detailed in the sections below.

---

## 2. Physical Product Returns

Physical products sold on SpiriVerse include crystals, candles, tarot decks, jewelry, books, spiritual tools, and similar items.

### 2.1 Return Eligibility

You may request a return or refund for a physical product if:

- The item arrived damaged, defective, or materially different from its listing description.
- The item was not delivered within the estimated delivery timeframe (allowing reasonable tolerance for shipping delays).
- You are exercising a right of return under the merchant's stated return policy.
- You are exercising your statutory rights (see [Section 12](#12-your-statutory-rights)).

### 2.2 Return Conditions

To be eligible for a return under a merchant's voluntary return policy:

- The item must generally be in its original, unused condition unless the item is faulty or not as described.
- Items should be returned in their original packaging where possible.
- You must initiate the return within the timeframe specified in the merchant's return policy as displayed at checkout.

### 2.3 One-of-a-Kind (OOAK) Items

Many items sold on SpiriVerse are one-of-a-kind (OOAK), such as unique crystals, handmade jewelry, or custom spiritual tools. OOAK items are eligible for refund if they are faulty, damaged in transit, or not as described. Merchants may restrict voluntary returns on OOAK items, and any such restriction will be clearly stated on the product listing.

### 2.4 Backordered Items

If you ordered an item on backorder:

- You will receive an estimated fulfillment date at the time of purchase.
- If the merchant cannot fulfill the backorder within a reasonable timeframe, you are entitled to a full refund.
- You may cancel a backorder at any time before the item has shipped and receive a full refund.

### 2.5 Return Shipping

- **Faulty, damaged, or not-as-described items:** The merchant is responsible for return shipping costs.
- **Change-of-mind returns (where permitted by merchant policy):** You are generally responsible for return shipping costs unless the merchant's policy states otherwise.
- Return shipping cost estimates are provided during the return process to help you make an informed decision before sending the item back.

### 2.6 Evidence for Returns

When requesting a return for a damaged, defective, or not-as-described item, you may be asked to upload photos or videos as supporting evidence. This helps merchants assess the issue quickly and process your refund without unnecessary delays.

---

## 3. Service Cancellations

SpiriVerse hosts two categories of services: synchronous (real-time) and asynchronous (delivered over a period of time). Cancellation rules differ by category and by the cancellation policy tier set by each practitioner.

### 3.1 Synchronous Services

Synchronous services are delivered in real time and include tarot readings, astrology consultations, reiki sessions, coaching, energy healing, and similar offerings. These may be delivered in person, online, by phone, or at a mobile location.

**Confirmation workflow:** After you book a synchronous service, the practitioner must confirm the booking. If the practitioner does not confirm or declines the booking, you will receive a full refund automatically.

**Cancellation by the practitioner:** If the practitioner cancels a confirmed booking, you will receive a full refund.

**Cancellation by you:** Your refund depends on the practitioner's cancellation policy tier (see [Section 3.3](#33-cancellation-policy-tiers)).

### 3.2 Asynchronous Services

Asynchronous services are delivered over a specified turnaround period and include written readings, oracle messages, voice note deliveries, and similar offerings. Before booking, you may be asked to complete a questionnaire so the practitioner can prepare your delivery.

- **Before the practitioner begins work:** You may cancel and receive a full refund, regardless of the cancellation policy tier, provided the practitioner confirms they have not yet started.
- **After the practitioner has begun work:** Refund eligibility depends on the cancellation policy tier and how much of the work has been completed.
- **If the practitioner fails to deliver within the stated turnaround period:** You are entitled to a full refund.
- **If the delivery is materially deficient or not as described:** You may request a refund or re-delivery through the dispute process.

### 3.3 Cancellation Policy Tiers

Each practitioner selects a cancellation policy for their services. The applicable tier is displayed on the service listing and at checkout.

#### Flexible

- Cancel up to **24 hours** before the scheduled service time for a **full refund**.
- Cancel less than 24 hours before for a **50% refund**.
- No-shows receive **no refund**.

#### Moderate

- Cancel up to **3 days (72 hours)** before the scheduled service time for a **full refund**.
- Cancel between 72 and 24 hours before for a **50% refund**.
- Cancel less than 24 hours before or no-show: **no refund**.

#### Strict

- Cancel up to **7 days** before the scheduled service time for a **full refund**.
- Cancel between 7 days and 48 hours before for a **50% refund**.
- Cancel less than 48 hours before or no-show: **no refund**.

#### Custom

- Some practitioners set custom cancellation terms. These will be clearly displayed on the service listing and at checkout. Custom policies must still comply with applicable consumer protection laws and SpiriVerse platform requirements.

**Note:** Cancellation policy tiers apply to voluntary cancellations by the buyer. If the service was not delivered as described, was of unacceptable quality, or the practitioner failed to show up, you are entitled to a full refund regardless of the cancellation tier.

---

## 4. Event and Workshop Refunds

Events and workshops on SpiriVerse include moon circles, meditation classes, ceremonies, yoga sessions, retreats, and similar gatherings. Events may offer multiple ticket variants at different price points.

### 4.1 Cancellation by the Organiser

If an event is cancelled by the organiser, all ticket holders will receive a full refund.

### 4.2 Cancellation by You

- **More than 7 days before the event:** Full refund, minus any non-refundable booking fees (if applicable and disclosed at checkout).
- **Between 7 days and 48 hours before the event:** 50% refund, unless the organiser's policy is more generous.
- **Less than 48 hours before the event:** Generally non-refundable, unless the organiser's policy permits it or statutory rights apply.
- Organisers may set more generous refund terms, which will be displayed on the event listing.

### 4.3 Ticket Transfers

Where an organiser permits ticket transfers, you may transfer your ticket to another person instead of requesting a refund. Transfer availability is shown on the event listing. SpiriVerse does not charge a fee for ticket transfers, though the organiser may set their own terms.

### 4.4 Waitlists

If you are on a waitlist and a spot becomes available, you will be notified and given a window of time to confirm. If you do not confirm, your spot will be offered to the next person on the waitlist. No charge is made until you confirm and complete the booking.

### 4.5 Event Date or Venue Changes

If an organiser materially changes the date, time, or venue of an event after you have purchased a ticket, you are entitled to a full refund if the change means you can no longer attend.

---

## 5. Digital Content

Digital content on SpiriVerse includes videos, podcasts, guided meditations, courses, downloadable files, and livestream recordings.

### 5.1 General Rule

Digital content is **generally non-refundable** once you have accessed, downloaded, or streamed the content. By purchasing digital content and accessing it, you acknowledge that you are receiving immediate access and that your right of withdrawal (where applicable) is waived upon access.

### 5.2 Exceptions

You may be eligible for a refund on digital content if:

- The content is materially different from its description or listing.
- The content is inaccessible due to a technical issue on SpiriVerse or the merchant's end that cannot be resolved within a reasonable timeframe.
- You have not accessed, downloaded, or streamed any part of the content and you request a refund within 14 days of purchase.
- Your statutory rights entitle you to a refund (for example, if the content is of unacceptable quality).

### 5.3 Subscriptions and Courses

If digital content is sold as a subscription or multi-part course, refund eligibility may depend on how much of the content you have accessed. Specific terms will be displayed at checkout.

---

## 6. How to Request a Refund

To request a refund:

1. **Log in to your SpiriVerse account** and navigate to your order history.
2. **Select the transaction** you wish to request a refund for.
3. **Choose "Request Refund"** and select the reason for your request.
4. **Provide supporting information**, including a description of the issue. For physical product issues, you may upload photos or videos as evidence.
5. **Submit your request.** The merchant will be notified and has **7 calendar days** to respond.

You will receive email updates as your refund request progresses. You can track the status of your request in your account dashboard. Refund requests move through the following statuses:

- **PENDING** -- Your request has been submitted and is awaiting merchant review.
- **IN_PROGRESS** -- The merchant is reviewing your request or a return is underway.
- **APPROVED** -- Your refund has been approved and is being processed.
- **REJECTED** -- The merchant has declined your request. You may escalate to SpiriVerse (see [Section 10](#10-dispute-escalation)).
- **REVERSED** -- A previously approved refund has been reversed (this occurs only in cases of fraud or policy violation).

---

## 7. Refund Processing Timeframes

Once a refund is approved:

- **Original payment method (card/bank):** Refunds are typically processed within **5-10 business days**, depending on your financial institution.
- **Store credit:** Applied to your SpiriVerse account **within 1-2 business days**.
- **Bank transfer:** Processed within **5-10 business days**.

Merchants have **7 calendar days** to respond to a refund request. If the merchant does not respond within this period, the auto-refund mechanism may apply (see [Section 11](#11-auto-refund-mechanism)).

---

## 8. Refund Methods

Depending on the transaction and merchant configuration, refunds may be issued via one or more of the following methods:

- **Original payment method:** The refund is returned to the card or payment method used for the original purchase. This is the default refund method.
- **Store credit:** The refund amount is credited to your SpiriVerse account balance, which can be used for future purchases on the platform.
- **Bank transfer:** In some cases, a refund may be issued directly to your bank account.

The available refund methods for your transaction will be presented during the refund request process. Where permitted by law, merchants may offer store credit as an alternative to a monetary refund for voluntary returns (change of mind). However, you are always entitled to a refund to your original payment method where your statutory rights apply.

---

## 9. Merchant Obligations

All merchants on SpiriVerse agree to the following obligations regarding refunds and returns:

- **Respond to refund requests within 7 calendar days.** Failure to respond may trigger an automatic refund to the buyer.
- **Clearly display refund and cancellation policies** on all product listings, service pages, and event pages before checkout.
- **Honour their stated policies.** Merchants must process refunds in accordance with the terms they have published.
- **Comply with applicable consumer protection laws** in the jurisdictions where they operate (Australia, United Kingdom, United States).
- **Provide fair and accurate product/service descriptions.** Misleading descriptions that result in refund claims may lead to account action.
- **Process approved returns promptly.** Once a return is received, merchants should inspect the item and approve or escalate the refund within a reasonable timeframe.
- **Bear return shipping costs for faulty or not-as-described items.**

SpiriVerse reserves the right to take action against merchants who consistently fail to meet these obligations, including suspension of selling privileges.

---

## 10. Dispute Escalation

If you and the merchant cannot reach a resolution, you may escalate the dispute to SpiriVerse for review.

### 10.1 When to Escalate

You may escalate a dispute if:

- The merchant has rejected your refund request and you believe the rejection is unjustified.
- The merchant has not responded to your refund request within 7 calendar days.
- You and the merchant have reached an impasse after direct communication.

### 10.2 How to Escalate

From your refund request in the SpiriVerse dashboard, select "Escalate to SpiriVerse." You may provide additional information and evidence to support your case.

### 10.3 Resolution Process

- SpiriVerse will review the details of the transaction, the refund request, the merchant's response (if any), and any evidence provided by both parties.
- SpiriVerse aims to resolve escalated disputes within **10 business days**, though complex cases may take longer.
- SpiriVerse's decision is intended to be fair to both parties. Possible outcomes include full refund, partial refund, store credit, or denial of the refund request.
- SpiriVerse's dispute resolution does not limit your right to pursue remedies through external channels, including consumer protection agencies or courts.

### 10.4 Evidence

Both buyers and merchants may upload photos, videos, screenshots, or written statements as evidence during the dispute process. Providing clear evidence helps SpiriVerse reach a fair resolution more quickly.

---

## 11. Auto-Refund Mechanism

To protect buyers from unresponsive merchants, SpiriVerse operates an auto-refund mechanism:

- If a merchant does not respond to a refund request within **7 calendar days**, the refund may be **automatically approved and processed** in favour of the buyer.
- The auto-refund is issued to the buyer's original payment method.
- Merchants are notified at the time of the refund request and receive reminders before the auto-refund deadline.
- The auto-refund mechanism does not apply where the merchant has already responded to the request (even if the response is a rejection -- in that case, you may escalate per [Section 10](#10-dispute-escalation)).

---

## 12. Your Statutory Rights

### 12.1 Australia -- Australian Consumer Law

If you are a consumer in Australia, you have rights under the Australian Consumer Law (Schedule 2 of the Competition and Consumer Act 2010) that cannot be excluded, restricted, or modified by this policy or any merchant policy. These include:

- **Consumer guarantees:** Goods must be of acceptable quality, match their description, be fit for their disclosed purpose, and match any sample or demonstration model. Services must be provided with due care and skill, be fit for purpose, and be delivered within a reasonable time.
- **Right to a remedy:** If a product or service fails to meet a consumer guarantee, you are entitled to a remedy. For major failures, you can choose a refund or replacement. For minor failures, the merchant may choose to repair, replace, or refund.
- **Services not yet provided:** You may cancel a service that has not yet been provided and receive a refund for any amount paid in advance.
- **No contracting out:** Any term of a merchant's policy that attempts to exclude or limit these guarantees is void.

For more information, visit the [Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC)](https://www.accc.gov.au/consumers/consumer-rights-guarantees).

### 12.2 United Kingdom -- Consumer Rights Act 2015

If you are a consumer in the United Kingdom, you have rights under the Consumer Rights Act 2015 and the Consumer Contracts (Information, Cancellation and Additional Charges) Regulations 2013 that cannot be excluded or restricted by this policy or any merchant policy. These include:

- **Goods must be of satisfactory quality**, fit for purpose, and as described. If goods are faulty or not as described, you have the right to a refund, repair, or replacement.
- **Short-term right to reject:** You have 30 days from delivery to reject faulty goods for a full refund.
- **Right to repair or replacement:** After 30 days, you have the right to request a repair or replacement. If this is not possible or unsuccessful, you may be entitled to a price reduction or final right to reject.
- **Digital content** must be of satisfactory quality, fit for purpose, and as described. If digital content is faulty, you have the right to a repair or replacement, and if that fails, a price reduction.
- **Services** must be performed with reasonable care and skill. If a service is not performed with reasonable care and skill, you are entitled to a repeat performance or a price reduction.
- **Cancellation rights:** For contracts concluded at a distance (online), you generally have a 14-day cooling-off period in which you may cancel for any reason and receive a full refund. This right may not apply to certain categories, such as personalised goods, sealed goods opened after delivery, or digital content once downloading or streaming has begun with your consent.

For more information, visit [Citizens Advice](https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/consumer/).

### 12.3 United States -- State Consumer Protection

Consumer protection laws in the United States vary by state. While there is no single federal right-of-return law for online purchases, many states have consumer protection statutes that may provide you with additional rights. General protections include:

- **FTC Act protections:** The Federal Trade Commission Act prohibits unfair or deceptive business practices. Merchants must deliver goods as described and within promised timeframes.
- **Mail, Internet, or Telephone Order Merchandise Rule:** If a merchant cannot ship within the promised timeframe (or 30 days if no timeframe is specified), they must notify you and offer the option to cancel for a full refund.
- **State-specific rights:** Many states have consumer protection statutes, cooling-off periods for certain transactions, and warranty laws (including implied warranties of merchantability). Your rights may vary depending on your state of residence.
- **Credit card chargebacks:** Under the Fair Credit Billing Act, you may have the right to dispute charges with your credit card issuer for goods or services not delivered as described.

We encourage US-based buyers to familiarise themselves with the consumer protection laws in their state. For general information, visit the [Federal Trade Commission (FTC)](https://www.consumer.ftc.gov/).

---

## 13. Exceptions and Exclusions

The following exceptions and exclusions apply to this policy. These do not override your statutory rights.

### 13.1 Items Not Eligible for Voluntary Return

The following items are generally not eligible for voluntary (change-of-mind) returns, unless they are faulty, damaged, or not as described:

- **Personalised or custom-made items** created specifically to your specifications.
- **Perishable goods** such as candles, incense, or herbal products that have been opened or used.
- **Intimate or hygiene-sensitive items** where return would pose a health or safety concern.
- **Items explicitly marked as final sale** on the product listing at the time of purchase.
- **Gift cards and store credit** (non-refundable and non-transferable for cash, except where required by law).

### 13.2 Abuse of Refund Policy

SpiriVerse reserves the right to limit or deny refund requests from buyers who demonstrate a pattern of refund abuse, including but not limited to:

- Repeatedly claiming items were not received when delivery tracking confirms otherwise.
- Returning items in a materially different condition than when received.
- Systematically requesting refunds after consuming or using services or digital content.
- Filing fraudulent chargebacks.

If SpiriVerse determines that refund abuse has occurred, we may restrict the buyer's ability to request refunds, suspend the buyer's account, or take other appropriate action.

### 13.3 Force Majeure

Neither SpiriVerse nor its merchants are liable for delays or failures caused by events beyond reasonable control, including natural disasters, pandemics, government actions, or disruptions to postal or delivery services. In such cases, SpiriVerse will work with merchants and buyers to find a fair resolution.

### 13.4 Third-Party Services

SpiriVerse is not responsible for refunds related to third-party services (such as payment processing fees) that may not be recoverable. Where a refund is issued, non-refundable third-party fees may be deducted if disclosed at the time of purchase.

---

## 14. Contact Us

If you have questions about this Refund & Returns Policy, or if you need assistance with a refund request, you can reach us at:

- **Email:** support@spiriverse.com
- **SpiriVerse Help Centre:** Available through your account dashboard.

We aim to respond to all enquiries within **2 business days**.

---

## Changes to This Policy

SpiriVerse may update this Refund & Returns Policy from time to time. Changes will be posted on this page with an updated effective date. We encourage you to review this policy periodically. Continued use of the SpiriVerse platform after changes are posted constitutes acceptance of the revised policy, except where changes would reduce your statutory rights.

# Acceptable Use Policy
